plugin.name: Maven 2 Plugin for the Google Web Toolkit
plugin.description: Maven 2 Plugin for the Google Web Toolkit

mojo.description:
Runs the the project in the GWTShell for development.
Note that this goal is intended to be explicitly run from the command line (execute phase=), whereas other GWT-Maven goals are not (others happen as part of the standard Maven life-cycle phases: "compile" "test" "install").

parameter.name: blacklist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.name: buildDir
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where project should be built.

parameter.name: codeserverPort
parameter.description: Runs the embedded GWT Code server on the specified port.

parameter.name: codeserverTargets
parameter.description: List of GWT module names that should be compiled with the GWT compiler.

parameter.name: compileSkip
parameter.description: Whether or not to skip GWT compilation.

parameter.name: compileTargets
parameter.description: List of GWT module names that should be compiled with the GWT compiler.

parameter.name: contextXml
parameter.description: Source Tomcat context.xml for GWT shell - copied to /gwt/localhost/ROOT.xml (used as the context.xml for the SHELL - requires Tomcat 5.0.x format - hence no default).

parameter.name: debugPort
parameter.description: Port to listen for debugger connection on.

parameter.name: debugSuspend
parameter.description: Whether or not to suspend execution until a debugger connects.

parameter.name: enableAssertions
parameter.description: Whether or not to enable assertions in generated scripts (-ea).

parameter.name: extraDir
parameter.description: Non-deployable files directory (1.6+)

parameter.name: extraJvmArgs
parameter.description: Extra JVM arguments that are passed to the GWT-Maven generated scripts (for compiler, shell, etc - typically use -Xmx512m here, or -XstartOnFirstThread, etc).

parameter.name: extraTestArgs
parameter.description: Extra JVM arguments that are passed only to the GWT-Maven generated test scripts (in addition to std extraJvmArgs).

parameter.name: gen
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT will write generated content for review (-gen option to GWTCompiler).

parameter.name: generateGettersAndSetters
parameter.description: Whether or not to generate getter/setter methods for generated classes.

parameter.name: generatePropertyChangeSupport
parameter.description: Whether or not to generate PropertyChangeSupport handling for generated classes.

parameter.name: generatorDestinationPackage
parameter.description: Destination package for generated classes.

parameter.name: generatorRootClasses
parameter.description: Top level (root) of classes to begin generation from.

parameter.name: gwtHome
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT is installed - for manual mode (existing GWT on machine - not needed for automatic mode).

parameter.name: gwtVersion
parameter.description: Set the GWT version number - used to build dependency paths, should match the "version" in the Maven repo.

parameter.name: htmlUnitBrowsers
parameter.description: Browser configs to use in HTML unit

parameter.name: i18nConstantsNames
parameter.description: List of names of properties files that should be used to generate i18n Constants interfaces.

parameter.name: i18nConstantsWithLookup
parameter.description: Whether or not to generate i18n Constants interfaces with the added ability to look up values at runtime with a string key.

parameter.name: i18nMessagesNames
parameter.description: List of names of properties files that should be used to generate i18n Messages interfaces.

parameter.name: i18nOutputDir
parameter.description: Location on filesystem to output generated i18n Constants and Messages interfaces.

parameter.name: jvm
parameter.description: Option to specify the jvm (or path to the java executable) to use with the test cases. For the default, the jvm will be the same as JAVA_HOME.

parameter.name: localWorkers
parameter.description: Specifies the number of worker threads to use to compile (1.6+)

parameter.name: logLevel
parameter.description: GWT logging level (-logLevel ERROR, WARN, INFO, TRACE, DEBUG, SPAM, or ALL).

parameter.name: noServer
parameter.description: Prevents the embedded GWT Tomcat server from running (even if a port is specified).

parameter.name: output
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT will write output files (-out option to GWTCompiler).

parameter.name: overwriteGeneratedClasses
parameter.description: Whether or not to overwrite generated classes if they exist.

parameter.name: pluginClasspathList
parameter.description: Maven Internal: List of artifacts for the plugin.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Runs the embedded GWT Tomcat server on the specified port.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: Project instance, used to add new source directory to the build.

parameter.name: resourcesOnPath
parameter.description: Whether or not to add resources root to classpath.

parameter.name: runTarget
parameter.description: URL that should be automatically opened by default in the GWT shell.

parameter.name: shellServletMappingURL
parameter.description: Specifies the mapping URL to be used with the shell servlet.

parameter.name: showTreeLogger
parameter.description: Toggles the graphical logger (1.6+)

parameter.name: sourcesOnPath
parameter.description: Whether or not to add compile source root to classpath.

parameter.name: style
parameter.description: GWT JavaScript compiler output style (-style OBF[USCATED], PRETTY, or DETAILED).

parameter.name: testFilter
parameter.description: Simple string filter for classes that should be treated as GWTTestCase type (and therefore invoked during gwtTest goal).

parameter.name: testSkip
parameter.description: Whether or not to skip GWT testing.

parameter.name: tomcat
parameter.description: Specify the location on the filesystem for the generated embedded Tomcat directory.

parameter.name: useHtmlUnit
parameter.description: Toggles HTMLUnit testing (GWT 2.0+)

parameter.name: useOophm
parameter.description: Project instance, used to add new source directory to the build.

parameter.name: webXml
parameter.description: Source web.xml deployment descriptor that is used for GWT shell and for deployment WAR to "merge" servlet entries.

parameter.name: webXmlServletPathAsIs
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not to add the module name as a prefix to the servlet path when merging web.xml. If you set this to false the exact path from the GWT module will be used, nothing else will be prepended.

parameter.name: whitelist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.name: workDir
parameter.description: Compiler work directory (1.6+)

mojo.description: Merges GWT servlet elements into deployment descriptor (and non GWT servlets into shell).

parameter.name: blacklist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.description: Whether or not to suspend execution until a debugger connects.

parameter.description: Whether or not to enable assertions in generated scripts (-ea).

parameter.name: extraJvmArgs

parameter.name: extraTestArgs
parameter.description: Extra JVM arguments that are passed only to the GWT-Maven generated test scripts (in addition to std extraJvmArgs).

parameter.name: gen
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT will write generated content for review (-gen option to GWTCompiler).

parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT is installed - for manual mode (existing GWT on machine - not needed for automatic mode).

parameter.name: gwtVersion
parameter.description: Set the GWT version number - used to build dependency paths, should match the "version" in the Maven repo.

parameter.name: htmlUnitBrowsers
parameter.description: Browser configs to use in HTML unit

parameter.name: i18nConstantsNames
parameter.description: List of names of properties files that should be used to generate i18n Constants interfaces.

parameter.name: i18nConstantsWithLookup
parameter.description: Whether or not to generate i18n Constants interfaces with the added ability to look up values at runtime with a string key.

parameter.name: i18nMessagesNames
parameter.description: List of names of properties files that should be used to generate i18n Messages interfaces.

parameter.name: i18nOutputDir
parameter.description: Location on filesystem to output generated i18n Constants and Messages interfaces.

parameter.description: Option to specify the jvm (or path to the java executable) to use with the test cases. For the default, the jvm will be the same as JAVA_HOME.

mojo.description: Extends the gwt goal and runs the project in the GWTShell with a debugger port hook (optionally suspended).

mojo.description: Invokes the GWTCompiler for the project source.

mojo.description:
Runs special (non surefire) test phase for GWTTestCase derived tests.
This is necessary because of several complications with regard to surefire and the classpath for GWTTestCase/JUnitShell. See further notes in source.

parameter.name: blacklist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.name: buildDir

parameter.description: Source web.xml deployment descriptor that is used for GWT shell and for deployment WAR to "merge" servlet entries.

parameter.name: webXmlServletPathAsIs
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not to add the module name as a prefix to the servlet path when merging web.xml. If you set this to false the exact path from the GWT module will be used, nothing else will be prepended.

parameter.name: whitelist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.name: workDir
parameter.description: Compiler work directory (1.6+)

mojo.description: Simply writes out all the scripts to the target folder.

parameter.name: blacklist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.name: buildDir
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where project should be built.

parameter.name: codeserverPort
parameter.description: Runs the embedded GWT Code server on the specified port.

parameter.name: codeserverTargets
parameter.description: List of GWT module names that should be compiled with the GWT compiler.

parameter.name: compileSkip
parameter.description: Whether or not to skip GWT compilation.

parameter.name: compileTargets
parameter.description: List of GWT module names that should be compiled with the GWT compiler.

parameter.name: contextXml
parameter.description: Source Tomcat context.xml for GWT shell - copied to /gwt/localhost/ROOT.xml (used as the context.xml for the SHELL - requires Tomcat 5.0.x format - hence no default).

parameter.name: debugPort
parameter.description: Port to listen for debugger connection on.

parameter.name: debugSuspend
parameter.description: Whether or not to suspend execution until a debugger connects.

parameter.name: enableAssertions
parameter.description: Whether or not to enable assertions in generated scripts (-ea).

parameter.name: extraDir
parameter.description: Non-deployable files directory (1.6+)

parameter.name: extraJvmArgs
parameter.description: Extra JVM arguments that are passed to the GWT-Maven generated scripts (for compiler, shell, etc - typically use -Xmx512m here, or -XstartOnFirstThread, etc).

parameter.name: extraTestArgs
parameter.description: Extra JVM arguments that are passed only to the GWT-Maven generated test scripts (in addition to std extraJvmArgs).

parameter.name: gen
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT will write generated content for review (-gen option to GWTCompiler).

parameter.name: generateGettersAndSetters
parameter.description: Whether or not to generate getter/setter methods for generated classes.

parameter.name: generatePropertyChangeSupport
parameter.description: Whether or not to generate PropertyChangeSupport handling for generated classes.

parameter.name: generatorDestinationPackage
parameter.description: Destination package for generated classes.

parameter.name: generatorRootClasses
parameter.description: Top level (root) of classes to begin generation from.

parameter.name: gwtHome
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT is installed - for manual mode (existing GWT on machine - not needed for automatic mode).

parameter.name: gwtVersion
parameter.description: Set the GWT version number - used to build dependency paths, should match the "version" in the Maven repo.

parameter.name: htmlUnitBrowsers
parameter.description: Browser configs to use in HTML unit

parameter.name: i18nConstantsNames
parameter.description: List of names of properties files that should be used to generate i18n Constants interfaces.

parameter.name: i18nConstantsWithLookup
parameter.description: Whether or not to generate i18n Constants interfaces with the added ability to look up values at runtime with a string key.

parameter.name: i18nMessagesNames
parameter.description: List of names of properties files that should be used to generate i18n Messages interfaces.

parameter.name: i18nOutputDir
parameter.description: Location on filesystem to output generated i18n Constants and Messages interfaces.

parameter.name: jvm
parameter.description: Option to specify the jvm (or path to the java executable) to use with the test cases. For the default, the jvm will be the same as JAVA_HOME.

parameter.name: localWorkers
parameter.description: Specifies the number of worker threads to use to compile (1.6+)

parameter.name: logLevel
parameter.description: GWT logging level (-logLevel ERROR, WARN, INFO, TRACE, DEBUG, SPAM, or ALL).

parameter.name: noServer
parameter.description: Prevents the embedded GWT Tomcat server from running (even if a port is specified).

parameter.name: output
parameter.description: Location on filesystem where GWT will write output files (-out option to GWTCompiler).

parameter.name: overwriteGeneratedClasses
parameter.description: Whether or not to overwrite generated classes if they exist.

parameter.name: pluginClasspathList
parameter.description: Maven Internal: List of artifacts for the plugin.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Runs the embedded GWT Tomcat server on the specified port.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: Project instance, used to add new source directory to the build.

parameter.name: resourcesOnPath
parameter.description: Whether or not to add resources root to classpath.

parameter.name: runTarget
parameter.description: URL that should be automatically opened by default in the GWT shell.

parameter.name: shellServletMappingURL
parameter.description: Specifies the mapping URL to be used with the shell servlet.

parameter.name: showTreeLogger
parameter.description: Toggles the graphical logger (1.6+)

parameter.name: sourcesOnPath
parameter.description: Whether or not to add compile source root to classpath.

parameter.name: style
parameter.description: GWT JavaScript compiler output style (-style OBF[USCATED], PRETTY, or DETAILED).

parameter.name: testFilter
parameter.description: Simple string filter for classes that should be treated as GWTTestCase type (and therefore invoked during gwtTest goal).

parameter.name: testSkip
parameter.description: Whether or not to skip GWT testing.

parameter.name: tomcat
parameter.description: Specify the location on the filesystem for the generated embedded Tomcat directory.

parameter.name: useHtmlUnit
parameter.description: Toggles HTMLUnit testing (GWT 2.0+)

parameter.name: useOophm
parameter.description: Project instance, used to add new source directory to the build.

parameter.name: webXml
parameter.description: Source web.xml deployment descriptor that is used for GWT shell and for deployment WAR to "merge" servlet entries.

parameter.name: webXmlServletPathAsIs
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not to add the module name as a prefix to the servlet path when merging web.xml. If you set this to false the exact path from the GWT module will be used, nothing else will be prepended.

parameter.name: whitelist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.name: workDir
parameter.description: Compiler work directory (1.6+)

mojo.description:
Runs the the project in the GWTShell for development.
Note that this goal is intended to be explicitly run from the command line (execute phase=), whereas other GWT-Maven goals are not (others happen as part of the standard Maven life-cycle phases: "compile" "test" "install").

parameter.description: Source web.xml deployment descriptor that is used for GWT shell and for deployment WAR to "merge" servlet entries.

parameter.name: webXmlServletPathAsIs
parameter.description: Specifies whether or not to add the module name as a prefix to the servlet path when merging web.xml. If you set this to false the exact path from the GWT module will be used, nothing else will be prepended.

parameter.name: whitelist
parameter.description: Whitelist URL pattern for GWTShell and JUnitShell

parameter.name: workDir
parameter.description: Compiler work directory (1.6+)
